citations.narrative:
***There is a singly housed duck in a large enclosure between the parking lot and the ticket office. The enclosure fence is
approximately four feet in height. There is no barrier fence outside of the primary enclosure to prevent the public from
making contact with the duck and there are no attendants present to observe public contact with the duck.
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals
and the public.
Correct by October 5, 2023.

***The water in the pool for the singly housed duck has a layer of debris covering the top of the main pool and the fill pool.
The water does not appear to be circulating and there is no overflow. The sides of the pool appear to be discolored as if
there is a layer of algae built up on them . Poor water quality and sanitation of the pool may lead to illness. Particulate
matter and debris must be removed as often as necessary to maintain the required water quality and minimize hazards to
the birds.
Correct by October 1, 2023.
Correct by
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with President.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
***There is a singly housed duck in a large enclosure between the parking lot and the ticket office. The enclosure fence is 
approximately four feet in height. There is no barrier fence outside of the primary enclosure to prevent the public from 
making contact with the duck and there are no attendants present to observe public contact with the duck.  
 
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with 
sufficient distance and/or barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals 
and the public. 
 
Correct by October 5, 2023. 
3.157(a)(1) 
   
Water quality. 
***The water in the pool for the singly housed duck has a layer of debris covering the top of the main pool and the fill pool. 
The water does not appear to be circulating and there is no overflow. The sides of the pool appear to be discolored as if 
there is a layer of algae built up on them . Poor water quality and sanitation of the pool may lead to illness. Particulate 
matter and debris must be removed as often as necessary to maintain the required water quality and minimize hazards to 
the birds. 
 
Correct by October 1, 2023. 
 
Correct by 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with President.
